title: Initial rate and half-life - first order reaction

content.description:
A scientist performed two trials in a study of the decomposition reaction of compound <math overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>C</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mtext>H</mtext><mn>5</mn></msub><mtext>Cl</mtext></math>, represented by the equation shown.

<math alttext="C 2 H 5 C l, gas, reacts to produce C 2 H 4, gas, plus H C l, gas" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mtext>C</mtext> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <msub> <mtext>H</mtext> <mn>5</mn> </msub> <mtext>Cl</mtext> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>→</mo> <msub> <mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <msub> <mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi> <mn>4</mn> </msub> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>+</mo> <mi>HCl</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </math>

Data from the trials are shown in the table.

<math alttext="the molar concentration of C 2 H 5 C l, end molar concentration, sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><msub><mtext>C</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mtext>H</mtext><mn>5</mn></msub><mtext>Cl]</mtext></mpadded></math>
 Initial Rate
 Half-Life

Trial 1
 <math alttext="1.0 molar" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.0</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></math>
 <math alttext="R sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>
 <math alttext="t sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

Trial 2
 <math alttext="2.0 molar " overflow="scroll"><mn>2.0</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></math>
 <math alttext="R sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>
 <math alttext="t sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>
content.question: Based on the data table, which of the following outcomes will provide the best evidence that the decomposition reaction is first order?

choices.label: <math alttext="R sub 2 equals R sub 1, and t sub 2 equals t sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>,</mo><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="R sub 2 equals R sub 1, and t sub 2 is not equal to t sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>,</mo><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>≠</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="R sub 2 is not equal to R sub 1, and t sub 2 equals t sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>≠</mo><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>,</mo><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="R sub 2 is not equal to R sub 1, and t sub 2 is not equal to t sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>≠</mo><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>,</mo><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>≠</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="R sub 2 is not equal to R sub 1, and t sub 2 equals t sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>≠</mo><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>,</mo><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

skill.text: 6.B: Support a claim with evidence from experimental data.
